images.caption: The Manor House, Hemingford Grey. The house was made famous by its long-term resident, Lucy M. Boston, who bought it in 1939 and rechristened it as Green Knowe and wrote several books set there. It dates back to the 1130s and includes beautiful tranquil gardens.

images.title: Row17 / Axe & Compass
images.caption: Axe & Compass in the sister village of Hemingford Abbots. The spire of the local church can be seen in the background.

images.title: The Bridge, St Ives by Philip Pankhurst, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Bridge, St Ives

images.title: Houghton Mill by Rob Noble, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Houghton Mill

description: This Cambridgeshire based village is located close to Huntingdon and St Ives. It's a nice place for country and riverside walks with the River Great Ouse running just to the north of the settlement. There's also the noteworthy Hemingford Grey Manor which dates from the 12th century. The interesting house and gardens are open to visitors. It is notable as one of the two oldest continually inhabited houses in Britain. This circular walk starts from the manor house and first takes you across Hemingford Meadow to neighbouring St Ives. Here you can cross the River Ouse on St Ives Bridge which includes an ancient chapel. Head west along the pretty town quay towards Houghton where you can explore the delightful Houghton Mill. The route then visits Hemingford Abbots before returning to the village.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Cock can be found on the High St, at postcode PE28 9BJ. The inn was named National Pub of the year twice in the last decade. They serve modern British fayre which you can enjoy in the lovely garden area which includes dining pods. The pub is dog friendly.

display_address: High Street, Hemingford Grey, Huntingdonshire, Cambridgeshire, Cambridgeshire and Peterborough, England, PE28 9BN, United Kingdom
